##

CVE-2025-27371
(6.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-07T17:15:22.190000

1 posts

In certain IETF OAuth 2.0-related specifications, when the JSON Web Token Profile for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication mechanism is used, there are ambiguities in the audience values of JWTs sent to authorization servers. The affected RFCs may include RFC 7523, and also RFC 7521, RFC 7522, RFC 9101 (JAR), and RFC 9126 (PAR).

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T19:39:44.000Z ##

Here are a couple interesting auth-bypass CVEs using JWTs. The vulns aren't in the JWT algorithms themselves, but in their implementations.

https://openid.net/notice-of-a-security-vulnerability/

OpenID Connect Core through 1.0 errata set 2 allows audience injection in certain situations. When the private_key_jwt authentication mechanism is used, a malicious Authorization Server could trick a Client into writing attacker-controlled values into the audience, including token endpoints or issuer identifiers of other Authorization Servers. The malicious Authorization Server could then use these private key JWTs to impersonate the Client.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27370

In certain IETF OAuth 2.0-related specifications, when the JSON Web Token Profile for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication mechanism is used, there are ambiguities in the audience values of JWTs sent to authorization servers. The affected RFCs may include RFC 7523, and also RFC 7521, RFC 7522, RFC 9101 (JAR), and RFC 9126 (PAR).

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27371

CVE-2025-2043
(4.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-03-07T00:32:02

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in LinZhaoguan pb-cms 1.0.0 and classified as critical. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /admin#themes of the component Add New Topic Handler. The manipulation of the argument Topic Key leads to deserialization. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-44754
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-06T21:31:26

1 posts

Cryptographic key extraction from internal flash in Minut M2 with firmware version #15142 allows physically proximate attackers to inject modified firmware into any other Minut M2 product via USB.

troed at 2025-02-28T17:21:06.922Z ##

Remember those posts on how Mitre declined assigning a CVE for an IoT exploit I identified and disclosed here a bunch of months ago?

It turns out Mitre did change their minds after I had explained how it could be exploited and thus it did get published through the CVE process after all. Just now.

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-44754

#IoT #HardwareHacking #ReverseEngineering

CVE-2024-38311
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-06T18:32:14

2 posts

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Apache Traffic Server. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.11, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.8, from 10.0.0 through 10.0.3. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 9.2.9 or 10.0.4, which fixes the issue.

cR0w at 2025-03-06T14:14:41.227Z ##

Apache Traffic Server has published a few different vulns.

https://lists.apache.org/thread/btofzws2yqskk2n7f01r3l1819x01023

CVE-2024-38311 - Request smuggling via pipelining after a chunked message
body
CVE-2024-56195 - Intercept plugins are not access controlled
CVE-2024-56196 - ACL is not fully compatible with older versions
CVE-2024-56202 - Expect header field can unreasonably retain resource

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38311

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56195

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56196

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-56202

updated 2025-03-06T18:31:23

CVE-2024-38311 - Request smuggling via pipelining after a chunked message
body
CVE-2024-56195 - Intercept plugins are not access controlled
CVE-2024-56196 - ACL is not fully compatible with older versions
CVE-2024-56202 - Expect header field can unreasonably retain resource

##
cR0w at 2025-03-06T15:29:16.072Z ##

DICOM viewers are used in some very interesting medical environments that are often not segmented as they should be.

sev:MED 4.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:L/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

A vulnerability was found in MicroDicom DICOM Viewer 2025.1 Build 3321. It has been classified as critical. Affected is an unknown function of the file mDicom.exe. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. The attack needs to be approached locally. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The vendor quickly confirmed the existence of the vulnerability and fixed it in the latest beta.

Even though it says "The attack needs to be approached locally" I assume that is a way to sandbag the CVSS score and that sending a malicious DICOM image to a user would be sufficient.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-2029

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-06T15:29:16.000Z ##

updated 2025-03-05T21:53:58

Ooh, an elegant RCE. How fancy. 🤵

https://github.com/livewire/volt/security/advisories/GHSA-v69f-5jxm-hwvv

Volt is an elegantly crafted functional API for Livewire. Malicious, user-crafted request payloads could potentially lead to remote code execution within Volt components. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.7.0.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27517

CVE-2024-55570
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T21:33:13

2 posts

/api/user/users in the web GUI for the Cubro EXA48200 network packet broker (build 20231025055018) fixed in V5.0R14.5P4-V3.3R1 allows remote authenticated users of the application to increase their privileges by sending a single HTTP PUT request with rolename=Administrator, aka incorrect access control.

usdAG at 2025-03-07T13:21:02.389Z ##

If you're using the #Cubro EXA48200 network packet broker, you should update to V5.0R14.5P4-V3.3R1.

Our expert, Tim Wörner, discovered a broken access control vulnerability in the user management API, which leads to privilege escalation (CVE-2024-55570).

📌 Read the full details here: https://herolab.usd.de/en/security-advisories/usd-2024-0014/

#CVE #AppSec #Cubro #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #Hacking #Pentest #CVE_2024_55570

##
usdAG@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-07T13:21:02.000Z ##

Our expert, Tim Wörner, discovered a broken access control vulnerability in the user management API, which leads to privilege escalation (CVE-2024-55570).

📌 Read the full details here: https://herolab.usd.de/en/security-advisories/usd-2024-0014/

##

CVE-2025-1125
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T21:33:13

1 posts

When reading data from a hfs filesystem, grub's hfs filesystem module uses user-controlled parameters from the filesystem metadata to calculate the internal buffers size, however it misses to properly check for integer overflows. A maliciouly crafted filesystem may lead some of those buffer size calculation to overflow, causing it to perform a grub_malloc() operation with a smaller size than expec

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T15:11:53.000Z ##

Grub vulns can be fun in some scenarios. Here are a few to peruse.

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-45779

An integer overflow flaw was found in the BFS file system driver in grub2. When reading a file with an indirect extent map, grub2 fails to validate the number of extent entries to be read. A crafted or corrupted BFS filesystem may cause an integer overflow during the file reading, leading to a heap of bounds read. As a consequence, sensitive data may be leaked, or grub2 will crash.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45779

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-45780

A flaw was found in grub2. When reading tar files, grub2 allocates an internal buffer for the file name. However, it fails to properly verify the allocation against possible integer overflows. It's possible to cause the allocation length to overflow with a crafted tar file, leading to a heap out-of-bounds write. This flaw eventually allows an attacker to circumvent secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45780

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-0689

When reading data from disk, the grub's UDF filesystem module utilizes the user controlled data length metadata to allocate its internal buffers. In certain scenarios, while iterating through disk sectors, it assumes the read size from the disk is always smaller than the allocated buffer size which is not guaranteed. A crafted filesystem image may lead to a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in critical data to be corrupted, resulting in the risk of arbitrary code execution by-passing secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0689

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-1125

When reading data from a hfs filesystem, grub's hfs filesystem module uses user-controlled parameters from the filesystem metadata to calculate the internal buffers size, however it misses to properly check for integer overflows. A maliciouly crafted filesystem may lead some of those buffer size calculation to overflow, causing it to perform a grub_malloc() operation with a smaller size than expected. As a result the hfsplus_open_compressed_real() function will write past of the internal buffer length. This flaw may be leveraged to corrupt grub's internal critical data and may result in arbitrary code execution by-passing secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1125

##

CVE-2025-0689
(6.4 MEDIUM)

A crafted filesystem image may lead to a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in

When reading data from a hfs filesystem, grub's hfs filesystem module uses user-controlled parameters from the filesystem metadata to calculate the internal buffers size, however it misses to properly check for integer overflows. A maliciouly crafted filesystem may lead some of those buffer size calculation to overflow, causing it to perform a grub_malloc() operation with a smaller size than expected. As a result the hfsplus_open_compressed_real() function will write past of the internal buffer length. This flaw may be leveraged to corrupt grub's internal critical data and may result in arbitrary code execution by-passing secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1125

It looks like this was fixed a while ago but the advisory and CVE are recent. Also, big you had one job vibes here.

https://devolutions.net/security/advisories/DEVO-2025-0003/

sev:MED 6.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

Incorrect authorization in PAM vaults in Devolutions Server 2024.3.12 and earlier allows an authenticated user to bypass the 'add in root' permission.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-2003

##

CVE-2024-45779
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T21:32:08

1 posts

An integer overflow flaw was found in the BFS file system driver in grub2. When reading a file with an indirect extent map, grub2 fails to validate the number of extent entries to be read. A crafted or corrupted BFS filesystem may cause an integer overflow during the file reading, leading to a heap of bounds read. As a consequence, sensitive data may be leaked, or grub2 will crash.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T15:11:53.000Z ##

Grub vulns can be fun in some scenarios. Here are a few to peruse.

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-45779

An integer overflow flaw was found in the BFS file system driver in grub2. When reading a file with an indirect extent map, grub2 fails to validate the number of extent entries to be read. A crafted or corrupted BFS filesystem may cause an integer overflow during the file reading, leading to a heap of bounds read. As a consequence, sensitive data may be leaked, or grub2 will crash.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45779

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-45780

A flaw was found in grub2. When reading tar files, grub2 allocates an internal buffer for the file name. However, it fails to properly verify the allocation against possible integer overflows. It's possible to cause the allocation length to overflow with a crafted tar file, leading to a heap out-of-bounds write. This flaw eventually allows an attacker to circumvent secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45780

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-0689

When reading data from disk, the grub's UDF filesystem module utilizes the user controlled data length metadata to allocate its internal buffers. In certain scenarios, while iterating through disk sectors, it assumes the read size from the disk is always smaller than the allocated buffer size which is not guaranteed. A crafted filesystem image may lead to a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in critical data to be corrupted, resulting in the risk of arbitrary code execution by-passing secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0689

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-1125

When reading data from a hfs filesystem, grub's hfs filesystem module uses user-controlled parameters from the filesystem metadata to calculate the internal buffers size, however it misses to properly check for integer overflows. A maliciouly crafted filesystem may lead some of those buffer size calculation to overflow, causing it to perform a grub_malloc() operation with a smaller size than expected. As a result the hfsplus_open_compressed_real() function will write past of the internal buffer length. This flaw may be leveraged to corrupt grub's internal critical data and may result in arbitrary code execution by-passing secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1125

##

CVE-2025-27500
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-03-05T20:16:46.363000

1 posts

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint(/api/upload) on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts an HTTP POST to upload a file which is then stored on the node and is available via URL. This can lead to a stored cross site scripting attack if the file uploaded contains malicious code

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T19:46:06.000Z ##

OpenZiti sounds delicious and can't be trusted. Which is good(?) for a zero-trust project.

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-frxm-vm48-5qf2

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint(/api/upload) on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts an HTTP POST to upload a file which is then stored on the node and is available via URL. This can lead to a stored cross site scripting attack if the file uploaded contains malicious code and is then accessed and executed within the context of the user's browser. This function is no longer necessary as the ziti-console moves from a node server application to a single page application, and has been disabled. The vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27500

https://github.com/openziti/ziti-console/security/advisories/GHSA-fqxh-vfv5-8qjp

OpenZiti is a free and open source project focused on bringing zero trust to any application. An endpoint on the admin panel can be accessed without any form of authentication. This endpoint accepts a user-supplied URL parameter to connect to an OpenZiti Controller and performs a server-side request, resulting in a potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. The fixed version has moved the request to the external controller from the server side to the client side, thereby eliminating the identity of the node from being used to gain any additional permissions. This vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27501

##

This can lead to a stored cross site scripting attack if the file uploaded contains malicious code and is then accessed and executed within the context of the user's browser. This function is no longer necessary as the ziti-console moves from a node server application to a single page application, and has been disabled. The vulnerability is fixed in 3.7.1.

This endpoint accepts a user-supplied URL parameter to connect to an OpenZiti Controller and performs a server-side request, resulting in a potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. The fixed version has moved the request to the external controller from the server side to the client side, thereby eliminating the identity of the node from being used to gain any additional permissions. SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241017 and prior uses an insecure AES key to encrypt client data (insufficient entropy). This may allow attackers to decrypt intercepted communications between the mobile app and iSolarCloud.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50684

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6140

SunGrow WiNet-S V200.001.00.P025 and earlier versions is missing integrity checks for firmware upgrades. Sending a specific MQTT message allows an update to an inverter or a WiNet connectivity dongle with a bogus firmware file that is located on attacker-controlled server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50696

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6120

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the userService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50693

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6124

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241104 and prior suffers from Missing SSL Certificate Validation. The app explicitly ignores certificate errors and is vulnerable to MiTM attacks. Attackers can impersonate the iSolarCloud server and communicate with the Android app.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50691

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6116

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the orgService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50689

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6122

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android application V2.1.6.20241017 and prior contains hardcoded credentials. The application (regardless of the user account) and the cloud uses the same MQTT credentials for exchanging the device telemetry.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50688

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6114

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the devService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50687

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6112

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the commonService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50686

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6118

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation, is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the powerStationService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50685

In NGINX Unit before version 1.34.2 with the Java Language Module in use, undisclosed requests can lead to an infinite loop and cause an increase in CPU resource utilization. This vulnerability allows a remote attacker to cause a degradation that can lead to a limited denial-of-service (DoS). There is no control plane exposure; this is a data plane issue only. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

Prototype pollution in Kibana leads to arbitrary code execution via a crafted file upload and specifically crafted HTTP requests. In Kibana versions >= 8.15.0 and < 8.17.1, this is exploitable by users with the Viewer role. In Kibana versions 8.17.1 and 8.17.2 , this is only exploitable by users that have roles that contain all the following privileges: fleet-all, integrations-all, actions:execute

kevinmirsky at 2025-03-07T16:19:18.548Z ##

CVE-2025-25015 - 9.9 Critical in Elastic Kibana.

##
TomSellers at 2025-03-06T16:27:20.675Z ##

Elastic has published a security advisory for a CVSSv3 9.9 rated RCE in Kibana versions 8.15.0 to 8.17.2. The access required varies depending on the version, see the post below.

Kibana version 8.17.3 has been released to address this vulnerability.

Note: Elastic indicates that the vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2025-25012 which is currently unlisted in the NIST NVD. NIST does seem to track this as CVE-2025-25015.

https://www.runzero.com/blog/elastic-kibana/

CVE-2025-1515
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-03-05T10:15:19.850000

4 posts

The WP Real Estate Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Authentication Bypass in all versions up to, and including, 2.8. This is due to insufficient identity verification on the LinkedIn login request process. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to bypass official authentication and log in as any user on the site, including administrators.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-03-06T15:14:30.000Z ##

updated 2025-03-05T10:15:19.480000

4 posts

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impa

CVE-2025-0954
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-03-05T10:15:19.130000

4 posts

The WP Online Contract plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the json_import() and json_export() functions in all versions up to, and including, 5.1.4. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to import and export the plugin's settings.

updated 2025-03-05T09:30:58

1 posts

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-05T14:26:39.000Z ##

We all love hardcoded creds in SCADA gear, right?

https://certvde.com/en/advisories/VDE-2025-021/

sev:CRIT 9.8 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Weidmüller product PROCON-WIN is affected by hard-coded credentials.

Weidmüller has released a new version of the affected product to fix the vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1393

##

CVE-2024-0114
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T03:30:55

2 posts

NVIDIA Hopper HGX for 8-GPU contains a vulnerability in the HGX Management Controller (HMC) that may allow a malicious actor with administrative access on the BMC to access the HMC as an administrator. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.

AAKL at 2025-03-05T19:44:58.101Z ##

Security Bulletin: NVIDIA Hopper HGX 8-GPU HMC - March 2025, affects CVE-2024-0114 and CVE-2024-0141 https://nvidia.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/5561

More: https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/product-security/ #cybersecurity #infosec #Nvidia

CVE-2025-1800
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T03:30:51

4 posts

A vulnerability has been found in D-Link DAR-7000 3.2 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects the function get_ip_addr_details of the file /view/vpn/sxh_vpn/sxh_vpnlic.php of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument ethname leads to command injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-50696
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T00:31:41

1 posts

SunGrow WiNet-S V200.001.00.P025 and earlier versions is missing integrity checks for firmware upgrades. Sending a specific MQTT message allows an update to an inverter or a WiNet connectivity dongle with a bogus firmware file that is located on attacker-controlled server.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T21:53:39.000Z ##

I don't know Sungrow but I know there are a bunch of #solarPunk nerds on here so maybe they would be interested in the 9 CVEs that were just published for their products.

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6126

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241017 and prior uses an insecure AES key to encrypt client data (insufficient entropy). This may allow attackers to decrypt intercepted communications between the mobile app and iSolarCloud.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50684

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6140

SunGrow WiNet-S V200.001.00.P025 and earlier versions is missing integrity checks for firmware upgrades. Sending a specific MQTT message allows an update to an inverter or a WiNet connectivity dongle with a bogus firmware file that is located on attacker-controlled server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50696

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6120

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the userService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50693

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6124

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241104 and prior suffers from Missing SSL Certificate Validation. The app explicitly ignores certificate errors and is vulnerable to MiTM attacks. Attackers can impersonate the iSolarCloud server and communicate with the Android app.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50691

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6116

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the orgService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50689

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6122

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android application V2.1.6.20241017 and prior contains hardcoded credentials. The application (regardless of the user account) and the cloud uses the same MQTT credentials for exchanging the device telemetry.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50688

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6114

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the devService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50687

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6112

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the commonService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50686

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6118

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation, is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the powerStationService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50685

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the devService API model.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T21:53:39.000Z ##

I don't know Sungrow but I know there are a bunch of #solarPunk nerds on here so maybe they would be interested in the 9 CVEs that were just published for their products.

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6126

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241017 and prior uses an insecure AES key to encrypt client data (insufficient entropy). This may allow attackers to decrypt intercepted communications between the mobile app and iSolarCloud.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50684

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6140

SunGrow WiNet-S V200.001.00.P025 and earlier versions is missing integrity checks for firmware upgrades. Sending a specific MQTT message allows an update to an inverter or a WiNet connectivity dongle with a bogus firmware file that is located on attacker-controlled server.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50696

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6120

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the userService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50693

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6124

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android app V2.1.6.20241104 and prior suffers from Missing SSL Certificate Validation. The app explicitly ignores certificate errors and is vulnerable to MiTM attacks. Attackers can impersonate the iSolarCloud server and communicate with the Android app.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50691

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6116

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the orgService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50689

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6122

SunGrow iSolarCloud Android application V2.1.6.20241017 and prior contains hardcoded credentials. The application (regardless of the user account) and the cloud uses the same MQTT credentials for exchanging the device telemetry.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50688

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6114

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the devService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50687

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6112

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the commonService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50686

https://en.sungrowpower.com/security-notice-detail-2/6118

SunGrow iSolarCloud before the October 31, 2024 remediation, is vulnerable to insecure direct object references (IDOR) via the powerStationService API model.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-50685

updated 2025-03-05T00:15:37.400000

4 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 135 and Thunderbird 135. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 136 and Thunderbird < 136.

##

CVE-2025-1933
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-05T00:15:36.470000

4 posts

On 64-bit CPUs, when the JIT compiles WASM i32 return values they can pick up bits from left over memory. This can potentially cause them to be treated as a different type. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 136, Firefox ESR < 115.21, Firefox ESR < 128.8, Thunderbird < 136, and Thunderbird < 128.8.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-03-05T20:14:25.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-1933 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-1933/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_1933

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-03-05T20:14:25.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-1933 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-1933/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_1933

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T21:31:04

4 posts

On affected platforms running Arista EOS with 802.1X configured, certain conditions may occur where a dynamic ACL is received from the AAA server resulting in only the first line of the ACL being installed after an Accelerated Software Upgrade (ASU) restart. Note: supplicants with pending captive-portal authentication during ASU would be impacted with this bug.

##

CVE-2025-22225
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.18%

updated 2025-03-04T18:34:42

9 posts

VMware ESXi contains an arbitrary write vulnerability. A malicious actor with privileges within the VMX process may trigger an arbitrary kernel write leading to an escape of the sandbox.

ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2025-03-06T00:59:56.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226: Zero-Day Vulnerabilities in VMware ESXi, Workstation and Fusion Exploited #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2025-22224-cve-2025-22225-cve-2025-22226-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-vmware-esxi

##
ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2025-03-06T00:59:56.000Z ##

CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226: Zero-Day Vulnerabilities in VMware ESXi, Workstation and Fusion Exploited #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2025-22224-cve-2025-22225-cve-2025-22226-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-vmware-esxi

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T17:11:48.000Z ##

Alright VMware admins, listen up! Broadcom's just dropped some critical security updates you absolutely need to get on. We're talking ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion – and guess what? There are active exploits in the wild! 😳

So, yeah, it's serious. Think CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226 – all leading to code execution, info leaks, and even sandbox escapes. Sounds like a hacker's dream come true, right? 😈 Definitely not what you want.

Specifically, this affects ESXi 8.0 and 7.0, plus Workstation 17.x and Fusion 13.x. So, you really gotta check your versions *now* and get those patches installed ASAP. Seriously, don't delay.

This kinda reminds me of a pentest we did for a client recently... almost missed something similar! It just goes to show that automated scans can't replace good old-fashioned manual checks. Speaking of, how do *you* secure your VMs? I'm curious to know! 🤔

#infosec #vmware #pentest #security

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T17:02:16.000Z ##

CISA has added four vulnerabilities to the KEV catalogue.

- CVE-2024-50302: Linux Kernel Use of Uninitialized Resource Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-50302

- CVE-2025-22224: VMware ESXi and Workstation TOCTOU Race Condition Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22224

- CVE-2025-22225: VMware ESXi Arbitrary Write Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22225

- CVE-2025-22226: VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion Information Disclosure Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22226 #VMWare #CISA #Linux #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-03-04T16:01:11.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2025-22225
Vendor: VMware
Product: ESXi
Date Added: 2025-03-04
Vulnerability: VMware ESXi Arbitrary Write Vulnerability
Notes: https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22225
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22225

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T14:38:20.000Z ##

Broadcom: VMSA-2025-0004: VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion updates address multiple vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226) https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390

More:

The Hacker News: VMware Security Flaws Exploited in the Wild—Broadcom Releases Urgent Patches https://thehackernews.com/2025/03/vmware-security-flaws-exploited-in.html @thehackernews #cybersescurity #infosec

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-03-04T14:19:26.000Z ##

3 different VMware zero days, under active exploitation by ransomware group

CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226

VMware ESXi
VMware Workstation Pro / Player (Workstation)
VMware Fusion
VMware Cloud Foundation
VMware Telco Cloud Platform

(Exploitation actually ESXi)

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390

#threatintel

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T13:37:08.000Z ##

Happy early Patch Tuesday. Broadcom brought some VMWare vulns to celebrate.

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390

sev:CRIT 9.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

VMware ESXi, and Workstation contain a TOCTOU (Time-of-Check Time-of-Use) vulnerability that leads to an out-of-bounds write. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22224

sev:HIGH 8.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

VMware ESXi contains an arbitrary write vulnerability. A malicious actor with privileges within the VMX process may trigger an arbitrary kernel write leading to an escape of the sandbox.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22225

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N

VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain an information disclosure vulnerability due to an out-of-bounds read in HGFS. A malicious actor with administrative privileges to a virtual machine may be able to exploit this issue to leak memory from the vmx process.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22226

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T13:00:27.000Z ##

VMSA-2025-0004: #VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion updates address multiple vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226)

VMCI heap-overflow vulnerability (CVE-2025-22224): A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

VMware ESXi arbitrary write vulnerability (CVE-2025-22225): A malicious actor with privileges within the VMX process may trigger an arbitrary kernel write leading to an escape of the sandbox.

HGFS information-disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2025-22226): A malicious actor with administrative privileges to a virtual machine may be able to exploit this issue to leak memory from the vmx process.

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390

#CVE_2025_22224 #CVE_2025_22225 #CVE_2025_22226 #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-48248
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-03-04T18:34:42

1 posts

NAKIVO Backup & Replication before 11.0.0.88174 allows absolute path traversal for reading files via getImageByPath to /c/router (this may lead to remote code execution across the enterprise because PhysicalDiscovery has cleartext credentials).

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/nakivo-arbitrary-file-read-poc-CVE-2024-48248

_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T11:13:06.000Z ##

The Best Security Is When We All Agree To Keep Everything Secret (Except The Secrets) - NAKIVO Backup & Replication (CVE-2024-48248) - watchTowr Labs https://labs.watchtowr.com/the-best-security-is-when-we-all-agree-to-keep-everything-secret-except-the-secrets-nakivo-backup-replication-cve-2024-48248/

##

CVE-2025-26596
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T18:34:27

2 posts

A heap overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The computation of the length in XkbSizeKeySyms() differs from what is written in XkbWriteKeySyms(), which may lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

OpenBSD: 009: SECURITY FIX: February 25, 2025

Multiple X server issues. CVE-2025-26594
CVE-2025-26595 CVE-2025-26596 CVE-2025-26597 CVE-2025-26598 CVE-2025-26599 CVE-2025-26600 CVE-2025-26601

https://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/7.6/common/009_xserver.patch.sig

#OpenBSD #Security

##

CVE-2025-27425
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T18:33:42

1 posts

Scanning certain QR codes that included text with a website URL could allow the URL to be opened without presenting the user with a confirmation alert first This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 136.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T14:06:38.000Z ##

Looks like Mozilla joined the patching party today.

Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox ESR 128.8: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-16/

Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox ESR 115.21: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-15/

Security Vulnerabilities fixed in Firefox 136: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-14/

Looks like a sev:CRIT and a few HIGHs in there. The one I want to point out to you dirty quishers is actually from a previous advisory ( https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2025-13/ ) but the CVE was published today: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27425

Scanning certain QR codes that included text with a website URL could allow the URL to be opened without presenting the user with a confirmation alert first This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 136.

Mozilla classified that one as a sev:LOW though so it's fine.

##

CVE-2025-22224
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.18%

updated 2025-03-04T18:33:39

14 posts

VMware ESXi, and Workstation contain a TOCTOU (Time-of-Check Time-of-Use) vulnerability that leads to an out-of-bounds write. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T17:11:48.000Z ##

Alright VMware admins, listen up! Broadcom's just dropped some critical security updates you absolutely need to get on. We're talking ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion – and guess what? There are active exploits in the wild! 😳

So, yeah, it's serious. Think CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226 – all leading to code execution, info leaks, and even sandbox escapes. Sounds like a hacker's dream come true, right? 😈 Definitely not what you want.

Specifically, this affects ESXi 8.0 and 7.0, plus Workstation 17.x and Fusion 13.x. So, you really gotta check your versions *now* and get those patches installed ASAP. Seriously, don't delay.

This kinda reminds me of a pentest we did for a client recently... almost missed something similar! It just goes to show that automated scans can't replace good old-fashioned manual checks. Speaking of, how do *you* secure your VMs? I'm curious to know! 🤔

#infosec #vmware #pentest #security

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T17:02:16.000Z ##

CISA has added four vulnerabilities to the KEV catalogue.

- CVE-2024-50302: Linux Kernel Use of Uninitialized Resource Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-50302

- CVE-2025-22224: VMware ESXi and Workstation TOCTOU Race Condition Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22224

- CVE-2025-22225: VMware ESXi Arbitrary Write Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22225

- CVE-2025-22226: VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion Information Disclosure Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-22226 #VMWare #CISA #Linux #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T13:00:27.000Z ##

VMSA-2025-0004: #VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion updates address multiple vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-22224, CVE-2025-22225, CVE-2025-22226)

VMCI heap-overflow vulnerability (CVE-2025-22224): A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.

VMware ESXi arbitrary write vulnerability (CVE-2025-22225): A malicious actor with privileges within the VMX process may trigger an arbitrary kernel write leading to an escape of the sandbox.

HGFS information-disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2025-22226): A malicious actor with administrative privileges to a virtual machine may be able to exploit this issue to leak memory from the vmx process.

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390

##

CVE-2025-26597
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T18:33:24

2 posts

A buffer overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. If XkbChangeTypesOfKey() is called with a 0 group, it will resize the key symbols table to 0 but leave the key actions unchanged. If the same function is later called with a non-zero value of groups, this will cause a buffer overflow because the key actions are of the wrong size.

stefano@bsd.cafe at 2025-02-26T07:26:45.000Z ##

OpenBSD: 009: SECURITY FIX: February 25, 2025

Multiple X server issues. CVE-2025-26594
CVE-2025-26595 CVE-2025-26596 CVE-2025-26597 CVE-2025-26598 CVE-2025-26599 CVE-2025-26600 CVE-2025-26601

https://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/7.6/common/009_xserver.patch.sig

#OpenBSD #Security

CVE-2025-1941
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T16:15:38.457000

4 posts

Under certain circumstances, a user opt-in setting that Focus should require authentication before use could have been be bypassed (distinct from CVE-2025-0245). This vulnerability affects Firefox < 136.

##

CVE-2024-9149
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-03-04T15:31:51

4 posts

Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Wind Media E-Commerce Website Template allows SQL Injection.This issue affects E-Commerce Website Template: before v1.5.

##

CVE-2024-57040
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T15:31:47

1 posts

TL-WR845N(UN)_V4_200909 and TL-WR845N(UN)_V4_190219 was discovered to contain a hardcoded password for the root account which can be obtained via a brute force attack.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T22:41:06.000Z ##

I have a couple questions here, but I think I'm just going to grab a beer instead.

https://security.iiita.ac.in/iot/hashed_password.pdf

TL-WR845N(UN)_V4_200909 and TL-WR845N(UN)_V4_190219 was discovered to contain a hardcoded password for the root account which can be obtained via a brute force attack.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-57040

##

CVE-2025-1244
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-03-04T09:31:43

2 posts

A flaw was found in the Emacs text editor. Improper handling of custom "man" URI schemes allows attackers to execute arbitrary shell commands by tricking users into visiting a specially crafted website or an HTTP URL with a redirect.

LorenzoAncora@ieji.de at 2025-03-03T23:56:01.000Z ##

@leadore yes, to activate this vulnerability and compromise your system, an attacker simply needs to trick you into visiting a specially crafted file, website, link with a redirect or in general a custom system manual reference with Emacs. No special configuration or interaction is required.

Details: https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-1244

##
LorenzoAncora@ieji.de at 2025-02-28T13:43:33.000Z ##

GNU Emacs: new critical remote shell injection vulnerability.

Red Hat discovered a command injection flaw in the text editor Emacs. It allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute any command on your computer. The vulnerability is activated when you visit a malicious website or link.

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-1244

---

#news #software #gnu #emacs #security #hacking #terminal #linux #cve #opensource #freesoftware

---

Mitigation: uninstall/update immediately.

##

CVE-2025-0359
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-04T06:30:42

1 posts

During an annual penetration test conducted on behalf of Axis Communication, Truesec discovered a flaw in the ACAP Application framework that allowed applications to access restricted D-Bus methods within the framework. Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-04T13:47:36.000Z ##

Axis stuff is always a fun target. Here are a few CVEs worth taking a look at if you're into that sort of thing.

https://www.axis.com/dam/public/b1/fe/46/cve-2025-0360pdf-en-US-466887.pdf

During an annual penetration test conducted on behalf of Axis Communication, Truesec discovered a flaw in the VAPIX Device Configuration framework that could lead to an incorrect user privilege level in the VAPIX service account D-Bus API.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0360

https://www.axis.com/dam/public/68/08/c5/cve-2025-0359pdf-en-US-466885.pdf

During an annual penetration test conducted on behalf of Axis Communication, Truesec discovered a flaw in the ACAP Application framework that allowed applications to access restricted D-Bus methods within the framework.
Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0359

https://www.axis.com/dam/public/a3/18/6e/cve-2024-47262pdf-en-US-466884.pdf

Dzmitry Lukyanenka, member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program, has found that the VAPIX API param.cgi was vulnerable to a race condition attack allowing for an attacker to block access to the web interface of the Axis device. Other API endpoints or services not making use of param.cgi are not affected.
Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47262

https://www.axis.com/dam/public/1d/d3/ef/cve-2024-47260pdf-en-US-466883.pdf

51l3nc3, member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program, has found that the VAPIX API mediaclip.cgi did not have a sufficient input validation allowing for uploading more audio clips then designed resulting in the Axis device running out of memory.
Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47260

https://www.axis.com/dam/public/13/cd/4a/cve-2024-47259pdf-en-US-466882.pdf

Girishunawane, member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program, has found that the VAPIX API dynamicoverlay.cgi did not have a sufficient input validation allowing for a possible command injection leading to being able to transfer files to the Axis device with the purpose to exhaust system resources.
Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47259

Other API endpoints or services not making use of param.cgi are not affected.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47262

Girishunawane, member of the AXIS OS Bug Bounty Program, has found that the VAPIX API dynamicoverlay.cgi did not have a sufficient input validation allowing for a possible command injection leading to being able to transfer files to the Axis device with the purpose to exhaust system resources.
Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-47259

CVE-2024-4885
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 83.60%

updated 2025-03-04T02:00:01.987000

4 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Progress WhatsUpGold.  The WhatsUp.ExportUtilities.Export.GetFileWithoutZip allows execution of commands with iisapppool\nmconsole privileges.

CISA Adds New Critical Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

CISA adds five new "Known Exploited Vulnerabilities" to its catalog, including CVE-2023-20118 and CVE-2024-4885, highlighting serious security...

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/75qf92

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T16:17:52.000Z ##

CISA has added to the KEV catalogue. Not Sure why Hitachi is in the mix.

- CVE-2023-20118: Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers Command Injection Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-20118

- CVE-2022-43939: Hitachi Vantara Pentaho BA Server Authorization Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2022-43939

- CVE-2022-43769: Hitachi Vantara Pentaho BA Server Special Element Injection Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2022-43769

- CVE-2018-8639: Microsoft Windows Win32k Improper Resource Shutdown or Release Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2018-8639

- CVE-2024-4885: Progress WhatsUp Gold Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-4885 #CISA #cybersecurity #infosec #Microsoft

Product: WhatsUp Gold

##

CVE-2018-8639
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.57%

updated 2025-03-04T02:00:01.987000

3 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows when the Win32k component fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 7, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 10, Windows 10 Servers. This

CVE-2022-43769
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 95.59%

updated 2025-03-04T02:00:01.987000

4 posts

Hitachi Vantara Pentaho Business Analytics Server prior to versions 9.4.0.1 and 9.3.0.2, including 8.3.x allow certain web services to set property values which contain Spring templates that are interpreted downstream.

Nuclei template

CISA has added to the KEV catalogue. Not Sure why Hitachi is in the mix.

- CVE-2022-43939: Hitachi Vantara Pentaho BA Server Authorization Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2022-43939

- CVE-2022-43769: Hitachi Vantara Pentaho BA Server Special Element Injection Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2022-43769

- CVE-2018-8639: Microsoft Windows Win32k Improper Resource Shutdown or Release Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2018-8639

- CVE-2024-4885: Progress WhatsUp Gold Path Traversal Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-4885 #CISA #cybersecurity #infosec #Microsoft

updated 2025-03-03T18:15:37.447000

1 posts

A vulnerability has been found in Totolink EX1800T 9.1.0cu.2112_B20220316 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects the function loginAuth of the file /cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi. The manipulation of the argument password leads to buffer overflow. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T14:26:16.000Z ##

I can't remember who I was talking to last week about TOTOLINK giving you the password for client-side auth. This isn't quite as bad, but a BoF in the password field is still not good.

https://github.com/watermelon-happy/cve/blob/main/ex1800tCVE.md

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

A vulnerability has been found in Totolink EX1800T 9.1.0cu.2112_B20220316 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects the function loginAuth of the file /cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi. The manipulation of the argument password leads to buffer overflow. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1852

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0686

##

CVE-2025-27498
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-03T17:15:16.443000

1 posts

aes-gcm is a pure Rust implementation of the AES-GCM. In decrypt_in_place_detached, the decrypted ciphertext (which is the correct ciphertext) is exposed even if the tag is incorrect. This is because in decrypt_inplace in asconcore.rs, tag verification causes an error to be returned with the plaintext contents still in buffer. The vulnerability is fixed in 0.4.3.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T17:52:35.000Z ##

This looks like a good one to start searching repos for.

https://github.com/RustCrypto/AEADs/security/advisories/GHSA-r38m-44fw-h886

aes-gcm is a pure Rust implementation of the AES-GCM. In decrypt_in_place_detached, the decrypted ciphertext (which is the correct ciphertext) is exposed even if the tag is incorrect. This is because in decrypt_inplace in asconcore.rs, tag verification causes an error to be returned with the plaintext contents still in buffer. The vulnerability is fixed in 0.4.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27498

##

CVE-2025-1801
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-03-03T15:32:56

1 posts

A flaw was found in the Ansible aap-gateway. Concurrent requests handled by the gateway grpc service can result in concurrency issues due to race condition requests against the proxy. This issue potentially allows a less privileged user to obtain the JWT of a greater privileged user, enabling the server to be jeopardized. A user session or confidential data might be vulnerable.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T17:19:13.000Z ##

This looks like a good PrivEsc to keep in your back pocket in case you come across a poorly maintained Ansible aap-gateway.

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2025-1801

sev:HIGH 8.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N

A flaw was found in the Ansible aap-gateway. Concurrent requests handled by the gateway grpc service can result in concurrency issues due to race condition requests against the proxy. This issue potentially allows a less privileged user to obtain the JWT of a greater privileged user, enabling the server to be jeopardized. A user session or confidential data might be vulnerable.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1801

CVE-2025-1867(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-03T09:30:41

1 posts

Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling') vulnerability in ithewei libhv allows HTTP Response Smuggling.This issue affects libhv: through 1.3.3.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T14:11:39.000Z ##

🥳 Looks like another perfect 10 in a cloned function that wasn't patched when the upstream version was. This time it's in libhv.

https://github.com/ithewei/libhv/pull/689

Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling') vulnerability in ithewei libhv allows HTTP Response Smuggling.This issue affects libhv: through 1.3.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1867

##

CVE-2025-1866
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-03T09:15:39.370000

1 posts

Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability in warmcat libwebsockets allows Pointer Manipulation, potentially leading to out-of-bounds memory access. This issue affects libwebsockets before 4.3.4 and is present in code built specifically for the Win32 platform. By default, the affected code is not executed unless one of the following conditions is met: L

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T14:15:04.000Z ##

🥳 GovTech CSG assigned two perfect 10s in one day, neither of which have to do with default creds. Kind of makes me feel like riverdancing. This one is in libwebsockets in warmcat.

https://github.com/warmcat/libwebsockets/commit/3f7c79fd57338aca1bf4a1b1f24e324b80d36265

Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability in warmcat libwebsockets allows Pointer Manipulation, potentially leading to out-of-bounds memory access. This issue affects libwebsockets before 4.3.4 and is present in code built specifically for the Win32 platform.

By default, the affected code is not executed unless one of the following conditions is met:

LWS_WITHOUT_EXTENSIONS (default ON) is manually set to OFF in CMake.
LWS_WITH_HTTP_STREAM_COMPRESSION (default OFF) is manually set to ON in CMake.
Despite these conditions, when triggered in affected configurations, this vulnerability may allow attackers to manipulate pointers, potentially leading to memory corruption or unexpected behavior.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1866

EPSS: 0.04%

🥳 Another perfect 10 in radare2, again in a copied vulnerable function whose patch was never applied to the copy. This is also the third perfect 10 I've seen today assigned by GovTech CSG.

https://github.com/radareorg/radare2/pull/23981

Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer vulnerability in radareorg radare2 allows Overflow Buffers.This issue affects radare2: before <5.9.9.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1864

CVE-2025-1842
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-03-03T01:15:10.023000

1 posts

A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in FITSTATS Technologies AthleteMonitoring up to 20250302. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /login.php. The manipulation of the argument username leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-03-03T14:37:02.000Z ##

Here's one of those "problematic" CVEs. This one is an XSS in FITSTATS Technologies AthleteMonitoring. I wouldn't normally care about it except I was joking with some people here last week about "problematic" CVEs and the vendor website lists this as a feature:

Track injuries, illnesses, mental health problems; manage medical records, SOAP notes & RTP programs securely on a HIPAA, PIPEDA & GDPR compliant platform.

From the CVE submission:

A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in FITSTATS Technologies AthleteMonitoring up to 20250302. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /login.php. The manipulation of the argument username leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1842

Eight new CVEs in Draytek Vigor routers. Good thing those aren't likely to be used for botnets or anything.

https://medium.com/faraday/advisory-multiple-vulnerabilities-affecting-draytek-routers-78a6cb8b3946

Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier and Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier and Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier and Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier and Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier and Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5.1 and earlier and Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier and Vigor2962/3910 4.3.2.8/4.4.3.1 and earlier and Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the CGI parser's handling of the "Content-Length" header of HTTP POST requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51139

Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier; Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier; Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier; Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier; Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier; Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5. and earlier; Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier; Vigor2962 4.3.2.8 and earlier; Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier; Vigor3910 4.4.3.1 and earlier a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been identified in the URL parsing functionality of the TR069 STUN server. This flaw occurs due to insufficient bounds checking on the amount of URL parameters, allowing an attacker to exploit the overflow by sending a maliciously crafted request. Consequently, a remote attacker can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51138

An issue in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload crafted APP Enforcement modules, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41340

An issue in the CGI endpoint used to upload configurations in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload a crafted kernel module, allowing for arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41339

A NULL pointer dereference in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted DHCP request.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41338

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to store passwords in plaintext.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41336

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to utilize insecure versions of the functions strcmp and memcmp, allowing attackers to possibly obtain sensitive information via timing attacks.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41335

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to not utilize certificate verification, allowing attackers to upload crafted APPE modules from non-official servers, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41334

Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier and Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier and Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier and Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier and Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier and Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5.1 and earlier and Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier and Vigor2962/3910 4.3.2.8/4.4.3.1 and earlier and Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the CGI parser's handling of the "Content-Length" header of HTTP POST requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51139

Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier; Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier; Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier; Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier; Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier; Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5. and earlier; Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier; Vigor2962 4.3.2.8 and earlier; Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier; Vigor3910 4.4.3.1 and earlier a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been identified in the URL parsing functionality of the TR069 STUN server. This flaw occurs due to insufficient bounds checking on the amount of URL parameters, allowing an attacker to exploit the overflow by sending a maliciously crafted request. Consequently, a remote attacker can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51138

An issue in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload crafted APP Enforcement modules, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41340

An issue in the CGI endpoint used to upload configurations in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload a crafted kernel module, allowing for arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41339

A NULL pointer dereference in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted DHCP request.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41338

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to store passwords in plaintext.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41336

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to utilize insecure versions of the functions strcmp and memcmp, allowing attackers to possibly obtain sensitive information via timing attacks.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41335

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to not utilize certificate verification, allowing attackers to upload crafted APPE modules from non-official servers, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41334

CVE-2024-41335
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-03-01T00:32:58

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-27T21:35:42.000Z ##

Eight new CVEs in Draytek Vigor routers. Good thing those aren't likely to be used for botnets or anything.

https://medium.com/faraday/advisory-multiple-vulnerabilities-affecting-draytek-routers-78a6cb8b3946

Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier and Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier and Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier and Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier and Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier and Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5.1 and earlier and Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier and Vigor2962/3910 4.3.2.8/4.4.3.1 and earlier and Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the CGI parser's handling of the "Content-Length" header of HTTP POST requests.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51139

Vigor165/166 4.2.7 and earlier; Vigor2620/LTE200 3.9.8.9 and earlier; Vigor2860/2925 3.9.8 and earlier; Vigor2862/2926 3.9.9.5 and earlier; Vigor2133/2762/2832 3.9.9 and earlier; Vigor2135/2765/2766 4.4.5. and earlier; Vigor2865/2866/2927 4.4.5.3 and earlier; Vigor2962 4.3.2.8 and earlier; Vigor3912 4.3.6.1 and earlier; Vigor3910 4.4.3.1 and earlier a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been identified in the URL parsing functionality of the TR069 STUN server. This flaw occurs due to insufficient bounds checking on the amount of URL parameters, allowing an attacker to exploit the overflow by sending a maliciously crafted request. Consequently, a remote attacker can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51138

An issue in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload crafted APP Enforcement modules, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41340

An issue in the CGI endpoint used to upload configurations in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload a crafted kernel module, allowing for arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41339

A NULL pointer dereference in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted DHCP request.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41338

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to store passwords in plaintext.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41336

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to utilize insecure versions of the functions strcmp and memcmp, allowing attackers to possibly obtain sensitive information via timing attacks.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41335

An issue in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload crafted APP Enforcement modules, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41340

An issue in the CGI endpoint used to upload configurations in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to upload a crafted kernel module, allowing for arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41339

A NULL pointer dereference in Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted DHCP request.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41338

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to store passwords in plaintext.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41336

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to utilize insecure versions of the functions strcmp and memcmp, allowing attackers to possibly obtain sensitive information via timing attacks.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41335

Draytek devices Vigor 165/166 prior to v4.2.6 , Vigor 2620/LTE200 prior to v3.9.8.8, Vigor 2860/2925 prior to v3.9.7, Vigor 2862/2926 prior to v3.9.9.4, Vigor 2133/2762/2832 prior to v3.9.8, Vigor 2135/2765/2766 prior to v4.4.5.1, Vigor 2865/2866/2927 prior to v4.4.5.3, Vigor 2962/3910 prior to v4.3.2.7, Vigor 3912 prior to v4.3.5.2, and Vigor 2925 up to v3.9.6 were discovered to not utilize certificate verification, allowing attackers to upload crafted APPE modules from non-official servers, leading to arbitrary code execution.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41334
